document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of frogs of the genus Cryptobatrachus (Anura: Hemiphractidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of frogs of the genus Cryptobatrachus (Anura: Hemiphractidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype :
ICN 38716
(original number PR 16770 ), an adult male, one of a series collected in La Victoria, quebrada Tucuy, municipio La Jagua de Ibirico, Cesar, Colombia , 928 m by Olga V. Castaño and others,
7 March 1996
.

Paratypes : All collected with holotype .
ICN 38692
-98, 38715, 38717 - 25 .

Diagnosis: A
Cryptobatrachus
with thin dorsolateral folds, finely granular skin on the dorsum with scattered larger warts (
Fig. 10
A), fingers lacking webbing, with subarticular adhesive pads, expanded disks on the digits, exhibiting sexual dimorphism in the size of the tympanum where the tympanum in males is 60.6-67.7 % size (mean 65.8 ± 0.9 ) of the eye, and not having the anterior part of the braincase broader than the middle part.
Etymology: Named for my late very close friend, Pedro Miguel Ruiz Carranza, who served a pioneering role in Colombian herpetology and was long-interested in frogs of this genus.

Description: Head width greater than head length, equal or less than body width; snout subacuminate in dorsal view, rounded in profile; nostrils protuberant, directed dorsolaterally; canthus rostralis rounded (but evident), weakly concave; loreal region concave; upper lips not flared; interorbital space flat (no cranial crests); skin of upper eyelid finely granular, without enlarged warts; temporal region sloping abruptly to lips; tympanum longer than high, nearly in contact with orbit; supratympanic fold pustular, extending posteroventrally to tympanum; postrictal tubercles subconical; an elongate tubercle lying on upper lip just anteriad to anteriormost postrictal (anteroventral to tympanum); choanae triangular in outline, not concealed by palatal shelf of maxillary arch; dentigerous processes of vomers posterior to choanae, bearing a row (straight to slightly arched) of 12-15 teeth; dentigerous processes narrowly separated medially; tongue broader than long, posterior edge feebly notched, completely adherent to floor of mouth; males lack vocal slits or vocal sac.
Skin of dorsum granular with larger warts scattered above shoulders; dorsolateral folds from above forearm to level of sacrum; skin of abdomen coarsely granular.

Thenar tubercle oval, twice size of oval palmar tubercle; no supernumerary palmar tubercles; basal subarticular tubercles round, distal subarticular tubercles broader than long, swollen on Fingers III-IV, bearing adhesive pads (defined by circumferential grooves); fingers bearing lateral keels; discs broader than long; first finger longer than second.

Heel lacking tubercles; inner edge of tarsus without fold or tubercles (or a slight keel evident, probably preservation artifact); outer edge of tarsus bearing faint series of low tubercles; inner metatarsal tubercle oval, its length 2 ½ times width; outer metatarsal tubercle oval, 1 / 3 to ½ size of inner metatarsal tubercle; no supernumerary plantar tubercles or only at base of Toe IV; ill-defined series of tubercles along outer edge of plantar surface; Toe III reaches to base of distal subarticular tubercle of Toe IV; Toe V reaches 1 / 3 distance between penultimate and distal subarticular tubercle of Toe IV; basal subarticular tubercles of Toes IV-V small, round; other subarticular tubercles larger; subarticular tubercles of Toes I-II with circumferential groove along lateral borders; distal subarticular tubercles of Toes III-V with circumferential grooves defining medial, lateral, and proximal edges of subarticular pads; heels of flexed hindlimbs (held perpendicular to sagittal plane), overlapping.

Coloration in alcohol: dorsum brown with pale pre-sacral spot and darker brown blotches; limbs pale brown with dark brown bands; chin mottled with brown or grey; venter cream; posterior edge of underside of thighs spotted with brown; posterior surfaces of thighs dark brown with cream spots or reticulum.
Measurements of holotype in mm.: SVL 44.5 , shank 27.9 , head width 17.7 , upper eyelid width 4.6 , IOD 3.4 , tympanum length 4.2 , eye length 6.2 , E-N 4.5 .
Distribution: This species is known from the western flank of the Serranía de Perijá at elevations between 930 and approximately 1800 m .
